Model
Model

Represents the server-side state and logic.  Comprises a snapshot of the current Objs, Grippers and Config.  Handles changes requested from Controllers, will check whether actions are valid and delegate necessary changes to its State instance.  For relevant updates, socket events are emitted to the model's room.

Functions
Constructor
Params
config

Config instance

socket

flask_socketio.SocketIO instance that views can connect with

room

name of the socket room this Model is assigned to

get_obj_dict
Returns

dictionary mapping Obj ids to Obj dictionaries

get_obj_ids
Returns

iterable of the Objs' ids

get_obj_by_id
Params
id

registered identifier of the Obj to retrieve

Returns

Obj instance, if existing, else None

get_gripper_dict
Returns

dictionary mapping Gripper ids to Gripper dictionaries

get_gripper_ids
Returns

iterable of the Grippers' ids

get_gripper_by_id
Params
id

registered identifier of the Gripper to retrieve

Returns

Gripper instance, if existing, else None

get_gripper_coords
Params
id

registered identifier of the Gripper in question

Returns

list: [x, y] or empty list if id does not exist

get_gripped_obj
Params
id

registered identifier of the Gripper in question

Returns

None or the id of the gripped Obj

get_config
Returns

dictionary representation of the internal Config instance

get_width
Returns

the world's width in blocks, defined by the internal Config

get_height
Returns

the world's height in blocks, defined by the internal Config

get_type_config
Returns

the Config's type name -> block matrix map

notify_views

Notify all listening views of model events (usually data updates)

Params
event_name

str, event type, e.g. 'update_grippers'

data

serializable data to send to listeners

set_state

Initialize the model's state. Emits 'update_state' event.

Params
state

State object or dict or JSON string

set_config

Change the Model's configuration. Overwrites any attributes passed in config and leaves the rest as before. New keys are added.  Emits 'update_config' event.

Params
config

Config or dict or JSON string

reset

Reset the current State. Emits 'update_state' event.

add_gr

Add a new Gripper to the internal State.  The start position is the center. Emits 'update_grippers' event.

Params
gr_id

identifier for the new Gripper

remove_gr

Delete a Gripper from the internal State.  Emits 'update_grippers' event.

Params
gr_id

identifier of the Gripper to remove

start_gripping

Start calling the function grip periodically until stop_gripping is called, essentially repeatedly gripping / ungripping with a specified Gripper.

Params
id

Gripper id

stop_gripping

Stop periodically gripping.

Params
id

Gripper id

grip

Attempt a grip / ungrip.

Params
id

Gripper id

start_moving

Start calling the function move periodically until stop_moving is called.

Params
id

Gripper id

x_steps

steps to move in x direction.  Step size is defined by step size or the internal Config.

y_steps

steps to move in y direction.  Step size is defined by step size or the internal Config.

step_size

optional: size of moving step in blocks; default: use move_step of internal Config

stop_moving

Stop calling move periodically.

Params
id

Gripper id

move

If allowed, move the Gripper x_steps steps in x direction and y_steps steps in y direction. Only executes if the goal position is inside the game dimensions. Emits 'update_grippers' event.

Params
id

Gripper id

x_steps

steps to move in x direction.  Step size is defined by step size or the internal Config.

y_steps

steps to move in y direction.  Step size is defined by step size or the internal Config.

step_size

optional: size of moving step in blocks; default: use move_step of internal Config

start_rotating

Start calling the function rotate periodically until stop_rotating is called.

Params
id

id of the Gripper whose gripped Obj should be rotated

direction

-1 for leftwards rotation, 1 for rightwards rotation

step_size

optional: angle to rotate per step; default: use rotation_step of internal Config

stop_rotating

Stop calling rotate periodically.

Params
id

Gripper id

rotate

If the Gripper 'id' currently grips some Obj, rotate it one step.

Params
id

id of the Gripper whose gripped Obj should be rotated

direction

-1 for leftwards rotation, 1 for rightwards rotation

step_size

optional: angle to rotate per step; default: use rotation_step of internal Config

start_flipping

Start calling the function flip periodically until stop_flipping is called.

Params
id

id of the Gripper whose gripped Obj should be flipped

stop_flipping

Stop calling flip periodically.

Params
id

Gripper id

flip

Mirror the Obj currently gripped by the given Gripper.

Params
id

Gripper id

start_loop

Currently not in use.

stop_loop

Currently not in use.
